benchmark_details.name: DebugBench
benchmark_details.overview: DebugBench is a new LLM debugging benchmark consisting of 4,253 instances to evaluate the debugging capabilities of large language models across various bug categories and types.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To comprehensively evaluate the debugging capabilities of large language models.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark's reliance on synthetic bugs may limit its applicability to real-world scenarios.

data.source: Collected from LeetCode and synthesized with GPT-4.
data.annotation: Implemented using GPT-4 to create bugs and explanations.

methodology.calculation: Pass Rate is calculated as the ratio of successfully fixed bug instances to total bug instances.
methodology.interpretation: A higher Pass Rate indicates better debugging capability of the model.
methodology.validation: Evaluations were performed on various models in zero-shot scenarios.
